pullRequest.title: DHFPROD-5223:Replace data-hub-operator with data-hub-common for certain default permissions
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
Replace data-hub-operator with data-hub-common for certain default permissions
Checklist:
- Note: do not change the below


Owner:


 JIRA_ID included in all the commit messages


 PR title is in the format JIRA_ID:Title


 Rebase the branch with upstream


 Squashed all commits into a single commit


 Added Tests


Reviewer:


 Reviewed Tests

nodes.bodyText:
Pinging @ryanjdew about this - I think this is reasonable to do, because by requiring data-hub-common-writer, we'd be requiring that a user have all the privileges in data-hub-common-writer, which the customer may not want to enable - i.e. the user may want a custom role that inherits data-hub-common but not data-hub-common-writer, yet still has the ability to modify the documents protected by these permissions.
So for document permissions, I think it's best to stick with data-hub-common for both "read" and "update".
